comments.body:
If this page is still up-to-date, please add:

```
doc_url: http://www.lighthacking.nl/nd2reader/
```
Yes, this page is up to date. Can you add it @caspervdw ?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@    only been definitively tested on NIS Elements 4.30.02 Build 1053. Support for older versions 
    is being actively worked on. The reader is written in the pims framework, enabling easy 
    access to multidimensional files, lazy slicing, and nice display in IPython.

  doc_url: http://www.lighthacking.nl/nd2reader/

comments.body:
Please submit an issue or PR upstream to add a `MANIFEST.in` to the source repo that will force the `LICENSE.txt` file distributed with the package. 

For GPL, we must distribute the license, so until the above happens in a future release, please copy the `LICENSE.txt` file into the recipe directory and add the following:

```
license_file: '{{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/LICENSE.txt'
```

See:
http://conda-forge.github.io/docs/meta.html#packaging-the-license-manually

and an example:

https://github.com/conda-forge/wsaccel-feedstock/tree/master/recipe

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/rbnvrw/nd2reader
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_file: '{{ environ["RECIPE_DIR"] }}/LICENSE.txt'
  summary: 'Pure Python library for reading NIS Elements ND2 images and metadata'
